instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-3437 PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS short
threads.message:
No liquid. Not a popped cap.

PPBUS_G3H 8.6V

First noticed S5 rails were 0.5V.
Checked EN 3v3 and 5V S5 all fine.
Tried Q7520 and Q7560 and U7501 That's when I notice PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISN is shorted to ground. No visible signs of bad caps.
Plugged it up to PSU 8V @3A and nothing is burning my finger. No caps, nothing.

Ideas please?

threads.title: [SOLVED] 820-3437 PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS short
threads.message:
C7621 got slightly warm at about 4A. Removed, short gone.
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISN now .7V

Doh! Dumb mother fucker! [SIZE=14px][B]Fuse[/B][/SIZE]... Oh geez
